title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Anti-Money
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Anti-Money 
Laundering: Beneficial Ownership of Corporate Entities) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (anti-money laundering beneficial ownership corporate entities) (amendment) regulation 2023

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the European Union
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations, “Principal Regulations” means the European Union 
(Anti-Money Laundering: Beneficial Ownership of Corporate Entities) 
Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 110 of 2019).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean european union (anti-money laundering beneficial ownership corporate entities) regulation 2019 (s.i no 110 2019)

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion of
text_raw:
3. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the insertion of 

the following definition: 

“ ‘high-risk third country’ means a jurisdiction identified by the European 
Commission in accordance with Article 9 of the Directive;”.
text_norm: 3 regulation 2 principal regulation amended insertion following definition high-risk third country mean jurisdiction identified european commission accordance article 9 directive

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 4. Regulation 25 of the Principal Regulations is amended –
text_raw:
4. Regulation 25 of the Principal Regulations is amended – 

(a) 

in paragraph (3), by the substitution of “Any person may, subject 
to paragraphs (3A), (3B) and (5),” for “A member of the public 
may, subject to paragraph (5),”, 

(b) by the insertion of the following paragraphs after paragraph (3): 

(3) unless 

“(3A) A person shall not be entitled to exercise the right of 
such person 
inspection under paragraph 
demonstrates to the Registrar that the person has a legitimate 
interest for doing so, that is to say that there is demonstrated to 
the Registrar by that person (through the making of a 
submission and, if required by the Registrar, the supplying of 
information or documents, including such information or 
documents as may be available relating to that person’s 
previous activities, if any, in the prevention, detection or 
investigation of money laundering or terrorist financing 
offences) – 

1 OJ No. L141, 5.6.2015, p.73. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 16th June, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [308] 3 

that the person is engaged in the prevention, 
(a) 
detection or investigation of money laundering or 
terrorist financing offences, 

to 

that 

inspect 

is seeking 

the person 

the 
(b) 
information referred to in paragraph (3) for the purposes 
of an activity in which he or she is engaged as referred 
to in subparagraph (a) (but such activity need not 
necessarily relate to cases of pending administrative or 
legal proceedings in respect of the relevant entity 
concerned), and 

(c) 

that the relevant entity concerned – 

(i) 
is connected with persons convicted 
(whether in the State or elsewhere) of an offence 
terrorist 
consisting of money 
financing, or 

laundering or 

(ii) 

holds assets in a high-risk third country. 

(3B) Having considered any submission made and, as the 
case may be, any information or documents supplied, under 
paragraph (3A), the Registrar shall either – 

if the Registrar is satisfied that the person 
(a) 
concerned has an interest as referred to in that paragraph, 
permit the person to inspect the information referred to 
in paragraph (3) in relation to the relevant entity 
concerned, or 

if the Registrar is not so satisfied, refuse to permit 

(b) 
the person to inspect that information.”, 

(c) 

in paragraph (4), by the substitution of “any other person” for 
“any member of the public”, 

(d) by the substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (5): 

“(5) Where a designated person or any other person seeks 
to have access to, or to inspect, any information in the central 
register so far as such information relates to a minor who is a 
beneficial owner of a relevant entity, the Registrar shall 
request the designated person or other person to provide, in 
writing, to the Registrar a summary of the grounds on which 
he or she considers it is in the public interest that that 
information be disclosed to him or her and – 

if the designated person or other person refuses or 

(a) 
fails to comply with that request, or 

(b) 
unless the Registrar, having considered such a 
written summary provided to the Registrar, is of the 
opinion that there are substantial grounds for the 
contention of the foregoing person that it is in the public 
interest that the information be disclosed to him or her, 

 
 4 [308] 

and 

the designated person or other person shall not be permitted by 
the Registrar to have access to, or to inspect, any information 
in the central register so far as such information relates to the 
minor concerned.”, 

(e) 

by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (5): 

“(5A) The Registrar shall keep a record of – 

(a) 
each instance of access to, or inspection of, any 
information in the central register being sought under 
any of paragraphs (3) to (5), and 

(b) 
each decision of the Registrar made in relation to 
it, indicating whether it is a decision to refuse to permit, 
or to permit, what is sought to be done, 

and each such record shall be retained by the Registrar for a 
period of 5 years from the date of the record’s creation.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 June, 2023. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 
Minister for Finance. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [308] 5
